Posted By: immelmann (9/9/2012 4:19:31 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Looks like she took a [Gut Shot](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gut Shot).  
  
ElMikkino, dberry02 -- I'm with you. Rebecca Guay is the ultimate master of making you want even the crappiest of cards by painting phenomenal art for them. Her [Boomerang](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=11182)'s the best. Her [Channel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=11182)'s the best (not a crap card so much as one your friends will never let you play). She does Fae like nobody else painting for Magic does Fae. Other than Chippy, I'm not sure what other Magic artist gets more gatherer praise than her. Somebody brilliant assigned her [Bitterblossom](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bitterblossom).
posts.html:
Looks like she took a Gut Shot.

Her Channel's the best (not a crap card so much as one your friends will never let you play). She does Fae like nobody else painting for Magic does Fae. Posted By: Salient (12/11/2012 8:13:43 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Why did such a useless card have to take such a generous name?  
  
For what reason does this have a mana cost of ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) and not ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)? Oldschool [Death Ward](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Death Ward) never was even remotely broken at the cost of ![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol), so why the colorless mana?  
Like this it's also worse than [Reknit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reknit) which can also be payed with white mana and can regenerate any permanent.  
[Wrap in Vigor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrap in Vigor) is also superior to this card most of the time.  
I can't quite believe Wizards didn't consider that when designing that card, but apparently they kept their eyes straight on [Regeneration](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Regeneration) only.  
  
Sigh...
posts.html:

Like this it's also worse than Reknit which can also be payed with white mana and can regenerate any permanent.
Wrap in Vigor is also superior to this card most of the time.
I can't quite believe Wizards didn't consider that when designing that card, but apparently they kept their eyes straight on Regeneration only.

Sigh...
